title.narrative: RECOFTC, Partnership for Forestry and Fisheries Community in Cambodia
RECOFTC, Partnerskap för lokal förvaltning av fiskeri och skogsresurser

description.narrative:
Partnership for Forestry and Fisheries Community in Cambodia (PaFF) har genomförts i två faser sen 2014. Den tredje och sista fasen av programmet leds av RECOTFC som tillsammans med tre andra organisationer (WWF, CEPA, NTFP-EP) kommer att fortsätta arbetet med bygga strukturer för naturresursförvaltning på gräsrotsnivå på den Kambodjanska landsbygden. PaFF 3 kommer att fokusera på att stärka lokalbefolkningens ekonomiska och kulturella rättigheter relaterade till markanvändning och naturresurser. Programmansatsen är rättighetsbaserad och den tredje fasen har ett ökat fokus på organisationernas roll som plattformar för demokratiprocesser och större åtnjutande mänskliga rättigheter.
Programmet kommer även att verka för förbättringar av regelverket kring naturresursförvaltning för att öka möjligheterna för mindre lokalsamhällen att bidra till och få en utkomst av naturen i sitt närområde. Eftersom programmet går in i sin tredje och sista fas så kommer också stor vikt läggas vid att bygga kapacitet och strukturer så att de lokala organisationerna kan fortsätta sitt arbete även efter projektet avslutats. Stöd kommer att ges till 77 organisationer från tidigare faser av programmet som sammantaget förvaltar drygt 90 000 hektar och har ca. 40 000 medlemmar i de fyra provinserna: Kampong Thom, Kratie, Stung Treng, och Preh Vihear
Programmet totala budget är ca. 52 miljoner kr och finansieras gemensamt med den schweiziska biståndsmyndigheten SDC. Sidas bidrag till programmet uppgår till 36 miljoner kr.

Partnership for Forestry and Fisheries Community in Cambodia (PaFF) has been conducted in two phases since its inception in 2014. The third phase will be led by RECOFTC in partnership with WWF, NTFP-EP and CEPA. The third phase will continue o empower communities and to improve their resilience by promoting community-based livelihoods, protecting ecosystems and reducing the pressures on the communal natural resource base. The third phase will have a stronger focused on improving local communities' enjoyment of their human rights, building capacity at the grassroots level for participation in democratic processes and promoting the rule of law in relation to access to natural resources.
The program will support improvements to the policy environment for natural resource management to promote local organisations to take responsible for and to receive benefit from management of natural resources in their communities. The third phase will also priorities improving the sustainability of the community based organisation. Support will be provided to 77 community based organisations from the previous phases in four provinces (Kampong Thom, Kratie, Stung Treng, Preah Vihear) that, in total, are managing more than 90 000 Ha with a combined membership of almost 40 000 persons.
The total program budget i approximately 52 million SEK and is funded jointly with the Swiss development agency SDC. Sida's financial contribution is 36 million SEK.
Decision: That Sida shall contribute to "Partnership for Forestry and Fisheries Community in Cambodia" during the period 01 July 2021 till 30 June 2023 with the following agreed sums per year.
2021: 15 000 000 SEK 2022: 15 000 000 SEK 2023: 6 000 000 SEK
That 15 000 000 SEK shall be allocated for this purpose from finance code 104050301 for 2021.
That 21 000 000 SEK for coming years for this purpose shall be allocated from the framework for outstanding commitments, with the indicative distribution as Sida's budget above.
That Samuel Hurtig, Head of Development Cooperation at the Embassy in Phnom Penh on behalf of Sida shall sign the agreement with RECOFTC principally in accordance with the enclosed draft agreement.

This contribution supports the final 2-year phase of an 8-year programme - the Partnership for Forestry and Fisheries Community in Cambodia (PaFF) - with a focus on improving natural resource management to benefit vulnerable groups. The primary focus of the third phase for is to build the capacity and promote the sustainability of community-based organisations, using a rights-based, democratic and rule of law based framework. PaFF III is well positioned to promote and develop innovative sustainable financing instruments and to promote human rights at the grassroots level by capacity development and policy advocacy targeting the revision on laws on Forestry and Fishery and community Networks.
Impact: Rural and indigenous communities and households are empowered to manage and protect their natural resources and secure their economic, social and cultural human rights by accessing long-term funding opportunities that contribute to sustained livelihoods and improved resilience to natural shocks
Outcome 1: Target communities have dedicated investments and strengthened capacity in order to exercise their secured rights and manage their natural resources sustainably in an inclusive and participatory manner
Outcome 2: Policy and regulatory processes and platforms for sustainable natural resource management and financing mechanisms, with participation of indigenous peoples and local communities, are supported and promoted.
Support will be provided to 77 community based organisations in four provinces (Kampong Thom, Kratie, Stung Treng, Preah Vihear) that are managing a total of 92 680 Ha. The community based organisations have a membership of almost 40 000 persons and benefit approximately 15 000 families. At the end of the 2 year programme the CBOs will have legally recognized land rights (tenure), approved management plans and increased management capacity. This together with improvement to the enabling environment and increased access to finance will empower the communities to further enjoy their economic, social, and cultural rights.

participating-org.narrative: RECOFTC/Regional Community Forestry Training Center for Asia and the Pacific
RECOFTC/Regional Community Forestry Training Center for Asia and the Pacific

tag.narrative: 15.1 - By 2020, ensure the conservation, restoration and sustainable use of terrestrial and inland freshwater ecosystems and their services, in particular forests, wetlands, mountains and drylands, in line with obligations under international agreements.

15.1 - Till 2020 bevara, återställa och hållbart använda ekosystem på land och i sötvatten och deras ekosystemtjänster, särskilt skogar, våtmarker, berg och torra områden, i enlighet med de skyldigheter som anges i internationella överenskommelser.
